result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher J Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances, except for those prescribed by treating health care provider.  Submit to random testing as required by agent.  Cooperate with AODA assessment and follow through with treatment, counseling and program recommendations.

Provide DNA sample as required by law and pay assessed surcharge.  Pay costs of supervision and court obligations.  No contact with victim, B.J.H., or co-defndants, J.R. and I.S.  Cooperate withi counseling, treatment and programs determined appropriate.  Follow through with recommendations.  Comply with Family Court and child support orders.  Voting prohibited until sentence has been completed and civil rights are restored.  Firearm prohibition warning given.

**AMENDED 10-24-2016:  Restitution is set at $0.**
Restitution hearing scheduled for October 24, 2016

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 3 years bifurcated sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.
Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent. Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. No contact with any co-defendant;s. No contact with vitcim VJH.   Ineligible voting notice and acknowledgement. Firearm warning given. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
